meanings.definition: The edge or border of something.
meanings.sent1: The cat walked along the margins of the garden, staying close to the fence.
meanings.sent2: She wrote her name neatly at the margins of the paper.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel played a game of tag with the bird, always staying within the margins of the tree branches.
meanings.sent4: The old house stood at the margins of the forest, its roof barely visible through the trees.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed gently along the margins of the meadow, reflecting the colors of the sunset.

meanings.definition: An amount by which something is won or falls short.
meanings.sent1: The company's profits increased, showing positive margins for the first time in years.
meanings.sent2: The team lost the game by a narrow margin, but they played well.
meanings.sent3: The chef added a pinch of salt to the soup, just to give it that extra margin of flavor.
meanings.sent4: She calculated the margin of error in her experiment to ensure accurate results.
meanings.sent5: The student scored above the passing margin on the test, feeling relieved.

meanings.definition: The blank space surrounding the text on a page.
meanings.sent1: She doodled in the margins of her notebook during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent2: The book had wide margins, allowing for notes to be written beside the text.
meanings.sent3: The teacher reminded the students to write their names in the margins of their test papers.
meanings.sent4: The magazine had colorful illustrations in the margins, making it more engaging to read.
meanings.sent5: He circled new vocabulary words in the margins of his textbook to remember them better.
